import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

train = pd.read_csv('../input/tabular-playground-series-jul-2021/train.csv')
train['date_time'] = pd.to_datetime(train['date_time'])
train.head()
source.29870b3d:
from sklearn.preprocessing import MinMaxScaler
scaler = MinMaxScaler()
train = pd.DataFrame(scaler.fit_transform(train),columns = train.columns,index = train.index)

fig = plt.figure(figsize=(20,10))
plt.plot(train.index,train['target_carbon_monoxide'])
plt.plot(train.index,train['sensor_1'])
plt.show()
source.9ef395e4:
train = pd.read_csv('../input/tabular-playground-series-jul-2021/train.csv')
train['date_time'] = pd.to_datetime(train['date_time'])
train = train.set_index('date_time').resample('4D').mean()
train = pd.DataFrame(scaler.fit_transform(train),columns = train.columns,index = train.index)

fig = plt.figure(figsize=(20,10))
plt.plot(train.index,train['target_carbon_monoxide'])
plt.plot(train.index,train['sensor_1'])
plt.show()
source.e591496d:
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(20,10))
plt.plot(train.index,train['target_carbon_monoxide'])
plt.bar(x= train.index, height=train['sensor_1'])
plt.show()
source.81d31720:
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(20,10))
plt.plot(train.index,train['target_carbon_monoxide']+0.5)
plt.bar(x= train.index, height=train['sensor_1'],width=1)
plt.show()
source.4e698950:
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(20,10))
plt.plot(train.index,(train['target_carbon_monoxide']-0.5)*1.5,lw=2.5, color='coral')
plt.bar(x= train.index, height=train['sensor_1']-0.5,width=2,alpha=0.3,color='lightcoral')

plt.gca().spines['right'].set_visible(False)
plt.gca().spines['top'].set_visible(False)

plt.xticks(font=font,fontsize=20)
plt.yticks(font=font,fontsize=20)

plt.title('The relationship with result and Sensor No_1', font=font, fontsize=40)

plt.show()

source.ad6729d4:
Tabular Playground Series - Jul 2021

![](https://storage.googleapis.com/kaggle-competitions/kaggle/25226/logos/header.png?t=2021-01-27-17-34-31) In this competition you are predicting the values of air pollution measurements over time, based on basic weather information (temperature and humidity) and the input values of 5 sensors. The three target values to you to predict are: target_carbon_monoxide, target_benzene, and target_nitrogen_oxides ## Data * train.csv - the training data, including the weather data, sensor data, and values for the 3 targets * test.csv - the same format as train.csv, but without the target value; your task is to predict the value for each of these targets. * sample_submission.csv - a sample submission file in the correct format.
